newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Budapest bourse closed lower after one day of rise.
newsitem.headline: Budapest bourse closed lower after one day of rise.

text.p: The Budapest Stock Exchange closed lower on Thursday moving in harmony with European bourses after days of opposite trend, traders said.
They added, however, that the Hungarian market's fall, which followed by one day of rise, stemmed mainly from the fact that Wednesday's recovery was not convincingly strong.
The BUX index finished at 5,118.60 points, down 69.29.

"I wouldn't dare to say that the market fell only because foreign markets declined," said Andrea Keresztesi of ABN-AMRO Hoare Govett. "Probably domestic investors thought (on Wednesday) that the market was set to rise," she added.
On Thursday many of the market's leading stocks closed lower, including the chemicals and pharmaceuticals stocks and hotelier Danubius.
Danubius ended at 4,755 forints, down 235, while chemicals TVK fell to finish at 2,050, down 110 and Borsodchem to 6,000, down 150.
Pharmaceuticals Egis closed at 9,505 forints, down 315, while Richter at 11,210, down 160 and Human at 2,900, down 50.

Keresztesi said she expected calm trading on Friday but said she did not share the opinion of those who believed the Hungarian share market could face a long fall which would last until the next phase of the privatisation of oil company MOL in May.
"I'm not that pessimistic," Keresztesi said. "Should the market fall some more it would become attractive again to trigger some rises."
